title: Bounce back in winter viruses as NHS top doctor warns ‘the worst is far from over’
description: Christmas and New Year gatherings may have caused a bounce back in winter viruses, as the health service also grapples with a vicious cold snap. Figures published today show that the number of patients in hospital beds with flu has risen by 9% on the previous week (2,924), following two weeks where that number had fallen. […]

title: Menopause and prostate conditions prioritised for NHS’s new online hospital
description: Menopause and prostate problems will be among the priorities for the NHS’s revolutionary new online hospital when it launches next year. The NHS has selected nine common conditions which will be the first to be treated by the NHS Online service, providing faster access to specialist care. title: NHS helped thousands of patients get home for Christmas despite doctors strike
description: The NHS safely discharged thousands of patients home to their families over the Christmas week (w/e 28 December), despite five days of strike action by resident doctors. title: NHS far from complacent despite drop in flu admissions
description: The number of people in hospital with flu dropped off during Christmas week (w/e 28 December), but England’s top doctor has warned that the NHS is ‘far from complacent’ during the cold snap. title: Hundreds of thousands of young children now to be protected against chickenpox
description: Hundreds of thousands of families with young children will be offered protection against chickenpox as part of their routine childhood vaccinations from today. The NHS’s vaccination programme is being expanded to include chickenpox (also known as varicella) for the first time to help shield young children from getting seriously ill.
